states.1: annual or biennial, without remains of old sheaths or culms
states.2: perennial with remains of old sheaths and/or culms

2.description: mature culms maximum height: data unreliable for large genera

5.description: culm nodes whether hairy or glabrous

7.description: leaf blades mid-width: data very incomplete

states.1: an unfringed membrane may be variously hairy or ciliolate

11.description: plants whether monoecious, with bisexual spikelets, or dioecious

states.1: monoecious with all the fertile spikelets unisexual
states.2: bisexual, with at least some bisexual spikelets
states.3: dioecious with separate male and female-fertile individuals

states.2: of spicate spike-like main branches of spikes, narrow racemes or narrow panicles
states.3: a false spike, with spikelets or spikelet clusters on contracted axes
states.4: a single raceme at least some of the spikelets clearly pedicellate
states.5: paniculate and not readily referable to any of the other states

13.description: inflorescence whether open or contracted: mainly applied to panicles

states.2: contracted very compact, or narrow and spike-like

14.description: inflorescence whether comprising a complex of partial inflorescences and intervening foliar organs

states.1: a complex of partial inflorescences and intervening foliar organs i.e., a pseudo-inflorescence
states.2: not comprising partial inflorescences and foliar organs

15.description: spikelet-bearing axes whether disarticulating; note that spikelet-bearing axes may be greatly reduced

states.1: disarticulating often manifested in clearly articulated rachides; excluding inflorescences falling whole (tumbleweeds)

17.description: spikelets grouping: recorded mainly in spikes and racemes

19.description: spikelets whether in regular long-and-short combinations, as exemplified in typical andropogonoids

states.1: consistently in long-and-short combinations i.e., pedicellate/sessile or long-pedicel/short-pedicel pairs or triplets: currently includes andropogonoid forms with the pedicellate spikelets reduced to their pedicels
states.2: not consistently in distinct long-and-short combinations

20.description: spikelets detail of long-and-short combinations (intended mainly for andropogonoids)

22.description: the shorter andropogonoid spikelets sessile or shorter-pedicelled, sexuality

23.description: the longer andropogonoid spikelets pedicelled or longer-pedicelled, sexuality

24.description: female-fertile spikelets approximate length, excluding any awns

states.1: compressed laterally lying on the side when placed on a flat surface
states.3: compressed dorsally, ventrally or dorsiventrally lying on front or back when placed on a flat surface

26.description: female-fertile spikelets location of disarticulation positions

states.1: readily disarticulating above the glumes when mature
states.3: falling with the glumes when mature pending data changes, including forms where the spikelets are shed by inflorescence disarticulation
states.4: not disarticulating common in cultivated cereals

27.description: female-fertile spikelets whether rachilla disarticulates between the florets of spikelets with two or more fertile florets

28.description: rachilla of female-fertile spikelets, whether terminated by a female-fertile floret, or prolonged

states.1: prolonged beyond the uppermost female-fertile floret i.e. not terminated by a female-fertile floret: note that racemose spikelets with three or more female-fertile florets have all been awarded this state
states.2: terminated by a female-fertile floret not prolonged

30.description: glumes of female-fertile spikelets, present or absent

31.description: glumes of female-fertile spikelets, number: glumes are barren, with neither axillary spikelets nor florets

32.description: glumes of female-fertile spikelets, whether markedly unequal in the intact spikelet; regardless of any differences in form

states.1: very unequal in length in the intact spikelet
states.2: more or less equal in length in the intact spikelet: generally includes subequal

33.description: glumes of female-fertile spikelets, lengths relative to proximal (adjacent) lemmas; refers to the longer glume when glumes unequal

states.1: decidedly shorter than the adjacent lemmas in intact spikelets
states.2: long relative to the adjacent lemmas more or less equalling or exceeding them

34.description: glumes of female-fertile spikelets, whether awned

35.description: glumes of female-fertile spikelets, whether carinate (i.e., one-keeled to middle or below)

states.2: non-carinate includes forms with more than one keel, as well as those with non-keeled glumes

36.description: upper glume (or the single glume) of female-fertile spikelets, mid-zone nerve number

37.description: female-fertile spikelets whether containing sterile or male-only florets in addition to female-fertile florets

states.2: or at least some of them, normally with incomplete sterile or male-only florets note that the situation at the apex of spikelets with more than three florets is often unknown or unclear

38.description: the incomplete male or sterile florets position in spikelet

states.3: both distal and proximal to the female-fertile florets

39.description: the proximal incomplete florets of the female-fertile spikelets, when present, number (intended mainly for panicoids)

40.description: the proximal incomplete florets of the female-fertile spikelets: sexuality

41.description: the proximal imperfect lemmas of the female-fertile spikelets: whether awned

42.description: number of female-fertile florets per female-fertile spikelet

44.description: female-fertile lemmas entire, whether pointed or blunt

45.description: female-fertile lemmas whether mucronate or awned

states.2: mucronate with a short, hard point or vestigial or incipient awn

46.description: awns of female-fertile lemmas, if present, number

47.description: awns of female-fertile lemmas, position of (main, median)

48.description: awns of female-fertile lemmas, whether straight or geniculate when dry

states.2: geniculate usually twisted at the base

49.description: awns main, median of the female-fertile lemmas, relative length

states.1: much shorter than the body of the lemma
states.2: about as long as the body of the lemma
states.3: much longer than the body of the lemma

50.description: female-fertile lemmas whether carinate (i.e., one-keeled at least to the middle on the back)

states.1: carinate with a single median keel
states.2: non-carinate rounded, flat, with two or more keels

51.description: female-fertile lemmas presence of germination flap

states.1: with a clear germination flap when mature

52.description: female-fertile lemmas number of nerves traversing mid-region

53.description: palea female-fertile, presence in female-fertile florets

states.1: relatively long three-quarters or more of female-fertile lemma length
states.2: conspicuous but relatively short less than three-quarters of female-fertile lemma length

57.description: lodicules of female-fertile florets, whether hairy

58.description: stamens number per female-fertile floret (not applicable to male spikelets or male florets)

59.description: ovary of female-fertile florets, whether apex glabrous or hairy

states.1: short punctiform or shortly elliptical, less than half length of fruit
states.2: long-linear more than half as long as fruit

65.description: pericarp whether fused or loose (or free)

states.2: loosely adherent fairly easily removable when soaked

66.description: maximum cells-distant count; reliably indicative of photosynthetic pathway

67.description: C4 biochemical type as determined by enzyme assay

68.description: leaf blade XyMS: reliably indicative of C4 type

states.1: XyMS+ C3, or C4 aspartate formers type PCK or NAD-ME (exceptions: Eriachneae)
states.2: XyMS? C4 malate formers type NADP-ME

69.description: leaf blade mesophyll presence of arm cells (= hatchet cells)

70.description: leaf blade mesophyll presence of fusoid cells

71.description: midrib of the leaf blade, prominence

states.1: conspicuous prominent in the outline, with distinctive sclerenchyma, etc.
states.2: not readily distinguishable other than by position

72.description: midrib of the mid leaf blade, vascularization

states.2: having a conventional arc of bundles i.e. at least three bundles
states.3: having complex vascularization i.e. with more than one bundle, not arranged in a conventional arc

73.description: midrib and/or middle part of leaf blade, whether extensively of colourless cells adaxially

74.description: presence in the leaf blade of small vascular bundles unaccompanied by sclerenchyma

states.1: many of the smallest vascular bundles unaccompanied by sclerenchyma
states.2: all or nearly all the vascular bundles accompanied by sclerenchyma

states.1: fruiting inflorescence a massive, spatheate cob, the fruits in many rows
states.2: fruiting inflorescence not as in maize
